titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ralph Heyward Isham Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Susan Brady

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday March 30, 2019 at 07:18

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, topical files, business and financial documents, photographs, and printed material which document Ralph Heyward Isham's British army service and his collecting and publishing of the James Boswell Papers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ralph Heyward Isham Papers (MS 1455). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Jonathan Isham in 1986; transfer from Boswell Papers, SML, in 1996 and 1997.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series and two additions: I. British Intelligence Files, 1917-1949. II. Boswell Papers Files, 1921-1949.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Ralph Heyward Isham Papers contain correspondence, topical files, business and financial documents, photographs and printed material which document Isham's British army service and his collecting and publishing of the James Boswell papers. The papers were donated to Manuscripts and Archives by Jonathan Isham in 1986. The three linear feet of papers are arranged in two series: I. BRITISH INTELLIGENCE FILES and II. BOSWELL PAPERS FILES.

Series I, BRITISH INTELLIGENCE FILES, consists of materials relating to Isham's work as head of a British army intelligence unit known as A-2, G.H.Q. When British soldiers were not demobilized immediately after the armistice in November of 1918, some disgruntled troops conducted "strikes" and refused to parade or obey orders. Isham's work in dealing with disaffection among troops at his command was brought to the attention of Field Marshall William Robertson who appointed Isham to his staff in 1918 to investigate and suppress Bolshevik activities which were believed to be responsible for the strikes. In order to assist him in accomplishing these goals, Robertson authorized the formation of the A-2 branch at General Headquarters. Isham was named director with a major and six other officers under his command. Through undercover investigations of suspected Bolsheviks and lectures to troops on the dangers of Bolshevism, the A-2 Branch was successful in ending and preventing strikes among servicemen. Subsequently, the A-2 Branch was placed within the Home Office so that Isham could conduct investigations and take disciplinary action against nonmilitary British citizens who were believed to be involved in traitorous activities.

Materials within the series include administrative correspondence and memoranda; correspondence between Isham and his agents; investigative reports by agents on individuals, organizations, and locations; records of the lecture program which describe the units addressed and impressions of troop morale; printed material; and several photographs.

Series II, BOSWELL PAPERS FILES, consists of correspondence, business and financial records, printed material and photographs related to Isham's collecting and publishing of the papers of James Boswell and Isham's involvement in the literary arena. Correspondents include the Talbots de Malahide from whom Isham obtained Boswell material; William Rudge, the printer of the eighteen-volume The Private Papers of James Boswell from Malahide Castle in the Collection of Lt.-Colonel Ralph Heyward Isham; Charles Getts, who, as Isham's agent arranged the collector's speaking engagements, and numerous individual and institutional subscribers to the Papers . The bulk of the business and financial records consists of invoices, receipts, inventories, sales accounts, and subscriber lists from William Rudge.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ralph Heyward Isham was born in New York City on July 2, 1890. He attended Cornell University (1908), Yale College (1910-1911), and New York Law School. He served in the British army during World War I, and following the armistice in November of 1918 he was named head of an intelligence unit which investigated and suppressed Bolshevik activities among militiary personnel. For his army service he was made a Commander of the Order of the British Empire, and retired at the rank of Lieutenant Colonel. Isham returned to New York City and was associated with a number of business concerns including Trumbull Securities Corporation, of which he was president. His avid collecting of James Boswell papers resulted in the private publication of The Private Papers of James Boswell from Malahide Castle in the Collection of Lt.-Colonel Ralph Heyward Isham (1928-1934) in eighteen volumes. He died in New York City in 1955.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains material arranged alphabetically by name of individual, organization or topic. Files containing three photographs and the chronologically arranged printed material appear at the end of the series.

Woolwich Shop Stewards and the Communist Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains material arranged alphabetically within divisions by type of material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This addition to the Ralph Heyward Isham Papers consists of correspondence; business and financial records; and printed material pertaining to Isham's collecting and publishing of the papers of James Boswell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This addition to the Ralph Heyward Isham Papers consists of correspondence, inventories, and background information relating to the acquisition of the Boswell Papers.
